content.text: Variables are containers for storing data values. JavaScript has three ways to declare a variable: var, let, and const.
The general rule: always declare variables with const. Use let only if the value will change. Avoid var in modern code.
All three keywords are shown below. Notice that const requires an initial value.

content.title: Example
code: var  name = "Alice";   // function-scoped, avoid in modern code
let  age  = 30;        // block-scoped, value can change
const PI  = 3.14159;   // block-scoped, cannot be reassigned

content.text: It is good practice to always declare variables at the top of their scope.
